description:
An event open for all Strategic Planners:

Pieter Goiris (Boondoggle) and Tom Himpe (Freelance) present their latest book #inthemoment. They are inviting Strategic Planners for a debate on how advertising is evolving towards 'Real Time' campaigns.

Dominique Poncin (DDB) will moderate the discussion. The event is free and open for Strategic Planners. You'll pay for your own beers.

Read more information about the book on press.boondoggle.eu (NL) or press.boondoggle.eu (FR)
name: Planners Café: #inthemoment

description:
You're invited to the next APG Belgium (ACC) Planners Café on the 20th of November. We'll meet each other at 20h in the back room of Café De Monk in the city centre of Brussels.

The concept is simple: Strategic Planners, talks and drinks. Entrance is free, drinks are on your own. Make sure you've had dinner before. You might hook up for dinner with some fellow planners to make your evening even more interesting.

The central guest in November is senior planner Piet Wulleman (Blog, LinkedIn) currently working as strategy director at Duval Guillaume Modem. (freelance at Brand Essentials) Piet recently published the book De Verlichte Merkdespoot (Facebook Page) at Lannoo.

Sign up for this Meetup to join us. If you can't make it int the end, please change your RSVP. Buy a copy of the book or read more on the previous links to get an idea of Piet's thoughts. And make sure you'll have some smart question or sharp remarks. I'll do my work to make sure this is not just a walk in the park for Señor Wulleman.
how_to_find_us: We're in a room at the back.
name: Planners Café - November

description:
The first edition of the Insight o/t Year award @ December’s Planners Café

What is the most important part of our job as a planner (apart from being smart on Twitter, knowing where to shop quirky shirts, feeling what is sooo 2012 and why)? It’s arguably the Insight. Having an opinion on almost every aspect of life, without necessarily putting it into practice ourselves, that’s our flesh and blood. 


Insights help clients and creatives in capturing and understanding what makes people tick and why. It’s the salt on our potatoes.
So let’s raise the glass and hail the best Insights we got!

December 10, at the Planners Café, we organize the very first Insight of the Year award. And you can take part!

WHAT
The Insight of the Year award night is the Battle of the Big Thinking, the Belgian way. Or a pecha kucha night, the planner way. Yet still different. Together, we vote for the best insight brought and presented by our fellow colleague planners. The winner will get eternal fame for more than 2 weeks. And a nize prize on top!

HOW
• Announce your candidacy via the APG facebook-page
• Prepare an interesting insight for the 10th of December. This doesn’t have to be linked to a specific campaign you already did, although it can. Can also be something you noticed, like “Mondays are the new Tuesdays” or “Most moms love their kids” etc.
• On December 10, you’ll have a maximum of 8 minutes to explain your insight.
• A brutally rude vox populi voting system will boo you out or woo you in.
• In case of ex aequo, a trio of very very old and wise planners will raise their thumbs.

This, my dear fellow planners, will be great fun!
name: Planners Café December: Insight of the Year

description:
Tom De Bruyne (LinkedIn) (ex-iMerge, ex-Boondoggle and now SUE Amsterdam and many other projects) triggered quite some attention when writing his Medium.com post: "The end of the digital agency as we know it."

Tom analysed: "The number of digital agencies that made it to the list of top lead agencies is fairly low. And those who did, kind of transformed into becoming a traditional advertising agency."  And asked the question: "What went wrong? Why did the digital agencies not live up to their promise?"  To conclude: "Being digital is the worst position to be in" And off course Tom will share his insights on "how 'digital agencies' should escape this gridlock".

We agree! Or we don't? Since a discussion with Tom De Bruyne is always top entertainment and the man has an impressive pair of balls, erm... brains, we invited Tom to Antwerp for an encounter with the finest selection of Belgian strategic planners. Yes, you.

So RSVP. Thursday the 20th of February in Antwerp. (exact location to be defined) First round of beers starts at 20h. See you there.
name: Planner Café: Tom De Bruyne on "Digital is dead"

description:
Sophie Graillot (LinkedIn) & Laurent Goffin (LinkedIn), 2 planners with a background in more digitally oriented environments, will come and talk about how 'digital' affects our trade, our client's trade, consumers' influence and decision processes and ultimately: the way we organise ourselves and deal with daily challenges. 

Hopefully followed by a discussion/debate which will aim to –at least- bring a solution for the false dichotomy between digital and analog. After all, if planners aren't going to bridge the gap, who will?

venue.name: Het Goudblommeke in Papier / La Fleur en papier Doré

name: Planners Café April: "Is digital a catalyst of shit?"

description:
Ask a planner, a creative and a client who's in charge for building brands and you'll get 3 different answers. One thing is for sure : brands don't grow out of brand onions. And brand design is becoming a serious contender in the brand building game. As planners we can probably learn a couple of things from brand designers : how they think about brands, how they use strategy, how they collaborate with creatives…

Tom Andries (Linkedin) is founder/creative partner of Branding Today and works for strong brands like Ecover, bpost, and C&A. Branding Today works as design partners for different ad agencies, mostly in close contact with planners.
name: Planners Café June: "Good design is good business" -Thomas J Watson, IBM 1947

description:
We’re pretty sure Uber doesn’t need another introduction. Since its launch Uber is growing faster than Ebay, but what is fueling their growth engine?
The service disrupts the market and surfs upon the same waves of sympathy that other services in the sharing-economy benefit from.
During this session we will try to gain insight in the mind-set of these new consumers. How is Uber creating added value for them?
Belgium's General Manager Filip Nuytemans (LinkedIn) will share Uber's story with us, and help us understand what makes them tick.
name: Planners Café October "Uber: Delivering value via disruption?"

description:
“En daarom hadden ze dus naar ons moeten luisteren"

Je herbegint 10 keer. Je bestelt pizza’s voor late night shifts. Je bent onuitstaanbaar voor je omgeving.

It’s pitch time!

Na weken zoeken, zwoegen en eindelijk je denkwerk presenteren, gaat een ander bureau met de klant aan de haal. Met een slechter idee uiteraard.

We zijn op zoek naar zoveel mogelijk planners (minstens 5) die met ons hun favoriete pitchporn willen delen: de meest sexy aanbevelingen die stierven in de meeting room. Laat je denkwerk niet vergeefs zijn, deel het met je mede-planners en krijg alsnog de lauweren waar je recht op hebt!

Het is niet de bedoeling dat jullie de volledige pitchaanpak van jullie agency uit de doeken doen. Wel dat je ons meeneemt in een strategische presentatie van een verloren pitch, die zo goed is dat je gerust mag afsluiten met de woorden: “En daarom hadden ze dus naar ons moeten luisteren”.

Dus schrijf je alvast in bij  [masked] (naam + pitch-case), als je wilt laten weten waarom ze naar jou hadden moeten luisteren!

___________________

“Et c'est pour cette raison qu'ils auraient dû nous écouter"

Vous recommencez 10 fois. Vous commandez des pizzas pour les long night shifts. Vous êtes insupportable pour vos proches.


It’s pitch time!

Après des semaines de recherche et de labeur, vous pouvez enfin présenter votre travail de réflexion, mais c'est une autre agence qui obtient les faveurs du client. Avec une moins bonne idée bien évidemment.
 Nous sommes à la recherche de planners (au moins 5) voulant partager leur pitchporn favorit: les recommandations les plus sexy jetées aux oubliettes dans la salle de réunion. Ne laissez pas votre travail de réflexion en vain, partagez-le avec nous et obtenez les lauriers auxquels vous avez droit!

Le but n'est pas de dévoiler l'approche complète du pitch de votre agence. Mais d'expliquer la présentation stratégique d'un pitch perdu, et qu'il soit si bon que vous pouvez terminer par: "Et c'est pour cette raison qu'ils auraient dû nous écouter".

Donc inscrivez vous auprès de [masked] (nom + pitch-case), si vous voulez faire savoir pourquoi ils auraient dû vous écouter!
name: Planners Café November: "En daarom hadden ze dus naar ons moeten luisteren"
